questions.explanation:
7. When will you deliver the furniture I ordered?
(A) By Tuesday at the latest. → Correct (specifies the delivery time)
(B) To several clients. → Incorrect (refers to recipients, not time)
(C) I bought a trailer. → Incorrect (unrelated to furniture delivery)

8. Is your flight tomorrow or this afternoon?
(A) In-flight snacks. → Incorrect (unrelated to flight time)
(B) It's this afternoon. → Correct (specifies the flight time)
(C) At baggage claim. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)

9. How often does the research team schedule training sessions?
(A) The team leader, I think. → Incorrect (refers to a person, not frequency)
(B) Some new software. → Incorrect (unrelated to training frequency)
(C) Every other week. → Correct (specifies the frequency)

10. Can I pay my bill with a credit card?
(A) Sure, that's fine. → Correct (confirms payment method)
(B) I don't believe him either. → Incorrect (unrelated to payment)
(C) The gas station on your right. → Incorrect (refers to location, not payment)

11. The project proposal still needs work.
(A) The other office. → Incorrect (refers to location, not proposal)
(B) No, it's still not working. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'work' as functionality)
(C) I can help you with it. → Correct (offers assistance with the proposal)

12. Where do you plan to stay during your visit to the city?
(A) I thought the building had twelve floors. → Incorrect (unrelated to staying plans)
(B) Oh, just to present at a conference. → Incorrect (refers to purpose, not location)
(C) At a friend's house. → Correct (specifies the staying location)

13. How did you improve the processing speed?
(A) That's a question for Silvia. → Correct (directs to someone who knows the answer)
(B) What's the speed limit? → Incorrect (misinterprets 'speed')
(C) I don't like to swim. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

14. Do you take exercise classes too, or just dance classes?
(A) The instructor teaches in the mornings. → Incorrect (refers to schedule, not class type)
(B) These shoes fit perfectly. → Incorrect (unrelated to classes)
(C) I only take dance. → Correct (specifies the type of classes)

15. When will the new coffee machine be installed in the lobby?
(A) No, it wasn't expensive. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not time)
(B) The front door is unlocked. → Incorrect (unrelated to installation)
(C) Within the next few days. → Correct (specifies installation time)

16. The new marketing director will be hired soon, won't she?
(A) Didn't you check your e-mail? → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring)
(B) It's about ten minutes from here. → Incorrect (refers to distance, not hiring)
(C) No, a little lower. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'Yes, by next month.'

17. I really need some help with the presentation graphics.
(A) Insook can do those for you. → Correct (offers help with graphics)
(B) A conference in Chicago. → Incorrect (unrelated to graphics)
(C) No, in Research and Development. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. Who can I talk to about scheduling a haircut?
(A) Will you be available tomorrow afternoon? → Incorrect (refers to availability, not contact)
(B) Not too short on the sides, please. → Incorrect (refers to haircut style)
(C) Thanks, the scheduling software has been helpful! → Incorrect (unrelated to contact)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'The receptionist.'

19. Did you already prepare the agenda for the department meeting?
(A) We should close the windows. → Incorrect (unrelated to the agenda)
(B) It was postponed. → Correct (implies agenda status indirectly)
(C) I bought them at the department store. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the agenda)

20. Do you take your coffee with or without milk?
(A) The coffee shop on Bayview Avenue. → Incorrect (refers to location, not preference)
(B) I prefer drinking tea. → Incorrect (avoids the coffee question)
(C) We'll need to place an order for paper. → Incorrect (unrelated to coffee)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'With milk.'

21. Why are you installing new software?
(A) Because our current software is outdated. → Correct (explains the reason for installation)
(B) We rented a large stall. → Incorrect (unrelated to software)
(C) I'm going to wear a jacket. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

22. When will next month's cost projections be ready?
(A) That portable projector was recently replaced. → Incorrect (unrelated to cost projections)
(B) An unexpected surplus. → Incorrect (refers to outcome, not timing)
(C) I sent an e-mail a few minutes ago. → Incorrect (unrelated to projections)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'By next week.'

23. Would you ask Tae-Joon to help set up the product display?
(A) Several kinds of headsets. → Incorrect (unrelated to the request)
(B) No, I can do it myself. → Incorrect (declines but doesn't address Tae-Joon)
(C) I can't see the bottom line of the chart. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'Sure, I'll ask him.'

24. Which version of the contract do you have?
(A) He's a general contractor. → Incorrect (unrelated to contract version)
(B) On the second floor. → Incorrect (refers to location, not version)
(C) The final one. → Correct (specifies the contract version)

25. Why isn't Ms. Pérez here yet?
(A) No, I can't hear anything. → Incorrect (unrelated to her absence)
(B) Company headquarters. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)
(C) Because she's meeting with her manager. → Correct (explains her absence)

26. I heard that our company might be merging with another one.
(A) Oh, I didn't know that. → Correct (acknowledges the merger news)
(B) A good-selling product. → Incorrect (unrelated to the merger)
(C) Akira told me to put it there. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Could you ask the next patient to come in?
(A) It's in the cabinet. → Incorrect (unrelated to the patient request)
(B) The waiting room is empty. → Correct (addresses the patient request)
(C) They're both studying nursing. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Are the blueberries ready to harvest?
(A) I'll try the strawberry flavor. → Incorrect (unrelated to blueberry harvest)
(B) We have a view of the beach. → Incorrect (refers to location, not harvest)
(C) It's not summertime yet. → Correct (implies blueberries aren't ready)

29. How long will it take us to get to the theater?
(A) Tickets for the performance are sold-out. → Incorrect (unrelated to travel time)
(B) At seven o'clock, I think. → Incorrect (refers to event time, not travel)
(C) Actually, I don't have a preference. → Incorrect (irrelevant to time)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'About 20 minutes.'

30. Are you going to send a report or give a presentation to our clients?
(A) We enjoyed their talk. → Incorrect (unrelated to the action)
(B) I'll probably do both. → Correct (specifies the planned action)
(C) Twenty people attended. → Incorrect (refers to attendance, not action)

31. When should we hang up the posters for our conference?
(A) Sure, my car will be fixed soon. → Incorrect (unrelated to poster timing)
(B) Next to the main entrance. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)
(C) The design still needs to be finalized. → Correct (implies timing delay)
